Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lI2wNy Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs UCLA's Lonzo Ball says his headline-making father is not a distaction Nicole Auerbach , USA TODAY Sports 12:17 a.m. ET Feb. 26, 2017 Lonzo Ball scored 11 points in UCLA's win over Arizona. (Photo: Casey Sapio, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
TUCSON, Ariz. — Lonzo Ball’s father, LaVar, doesn’t shy away from giving his opinion about anything related to his son, the star of the No. 5 UCLA men’s basketball team. 
But he's a bit much, even with an extremely talented son projected to be a top-three pick in June’s NBA draft. 
LaVar said last week that Lonzo is better than two-time NBA MVP Steph Curry … already. He then said Saturday that the only team Lonzo will play for is the Los Angeles Lakers, then attempted to clarify that by saying he wants his son to play for the Lakers and learn from Magic Johnson. 
Lately, LaVar has been in the headlines more frequently than his son has — which could certainly be seen as a distraction, or at the very least an annoyance. But not to Lonzo, who spoke to reporters after beating Arizona, 77-72 . 
"No, it’s not distracting," Lonzo Ball said. "I just go out there and play basketball." 
When asked specifically about the Lakers comment, Ball replied: "All I do is go out there and play basketball."
